pullRequest.title: Fix file download links
pullRequest.bodyText:
What does this PR change?
This PR fixes file download links that are broken since senna.js was introduced.
This PR is a follow up of #2649 that fixes a similar issue for CSV downloads.
GUI diff
No difference.

 DONE

Documentation


No documentation needed: This is just a fix


 DONE


Test coverage


Cucumber tests were added


 DONE


Links
Fixes: https://github.com/SUSE/spacewalk/issues/13317
Tracks: https://github.com/SUSE/spacewalk/pull/13428
Tracks: https://github.com/SUSE/spacewalk/pull/13431

 DONE

Changelogs
If you don't need a changelog check, please mark this checkbox:

 No changelog needed

If you uncheck the checkbox after the PR is created, you will need to re-run changelog_test (see below)
Re-run a test
If you need to re-run a test, please mark the related checkbox, it will be unchecked automatically once it has re-run:

 Re-run test "changelog_test"
 Re-run test "backend_unittests_pgsql"
 Re-run test "java_pgsql_tests"
 Re-run test "schema_migration_test_oracle"
 Re-run test "schema_migration_test_pgsql"
 Re-run test "susemanager_unittests"
 Re-run test "javascript_lint"
 Re-run test "spacecmd_unittests"

nodes.bodyText: @ncounter @moio We should discuss this next week.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -27,8 +27,9 @@
+ <%-- TODO Shouldn't we add the 'data-senna-off="true"' on 'StringResource_*.xml' files directly, instead of injecting it here? --%>

beforeCommit.message:
Fix file download links

File download links are broken since "senna.js" integration.

Fixes: https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1179324

Signed-off-by: Ricardo Marques <rimarques@suse.com>

afterCommit.message:
Fix file download links

File download links are broken since "senna.js" integration.

Fixes: https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1179324

Signed-off-by: Ricardo Marques <rimarques@suse.com>

nodes.bodyText: Shouldn't we add the data-senna-off="true" on StringResource_*.xml files directly, instead of injecting it here?

nodes.bodyText: I think ${HOME} is more correct here.. I'll test it and update PR accordingly if works.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -92,6 +92,16 @@ Feature: Action chains on Salt minions
     Then I should see a "Revision 1 of /etc/action-chain.cnf from channel Action Chain Channel" text
     And I should see a "Update Configuration File" button
 
+  Scenario: Download the configuration file from configuration channel
+    Given I am authorized as "admin" with password "admin"
+    When I follow the left menu "Configuration > Channels"
+    And I follow "Action Chain Channel"
+    And I follow "List/Remove Files"
+    And I follow "/etc/action-chain.cnf"
+    And I follow "Download File"
+    And I wait until file "${PWD}/action-chain.cnf" exists on "localhost"
